Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can draw various types of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, flowers, and animals like lizards, squirrels, and fish.
The student can show differences in plant and animal diversity between the two habitats through their drawings.
The student can observe patterns in the types of living things found in each habitat and represent these patterns in their drawings.
